Articles.Content:
I try to land on the Mun, but came in too fast. Yet instead of crashing on Mun. I went THROUGH Mun. ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)

[http://img204.imageshack.us/img204/4756/kerbalwehaveanproblem.jpg](http://img204.imageshack.us/img204/4756/kerbalwehaveanproblem.jpg)

It was my first landing attempt too. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Well this is....

![moonf.png](http://wearscience.com/img300/moonf.png)

I hate it when that happens!

Actually, it\'s probably that known bug about the terrain detail setting. The work around is to change the graphics setting for terrain detail to a higher figure. Lower terrain detail somehow affects the collision check. Increasing terrain detail fixed it for me.
Tip: Holding alt while hitting printscreen lets you take a picture only of the active window ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Wow. I did not know that. Thanks, Nova.

You could also just press F1 and you\'ll get a really high-res KSP window photo.
